title: "Using build services to create Chocolatey packages"

---

<p><img style="float: right;" src="data:image/png;base64,"><a href="http://www.chocolatey.org">Chocolatey</a> is a Machine Package Manager, somewhat like apt-get, built with Windows in mind. It lets us install software onto our machine, supports updates and dependencies, much like NuGet or npm do. <a href="http://www.myget.org">MyGet</a> has always supported feeds containing Chocolatey packages, making it easy to distribute software packages across teams or with customers. In this post, we’ll show you a trick on how to build Chocolatey packages using MyGet build services. It’s the least we can do as a Belgian company – our country is known for chocolates after all…</p> <p><a href="http://docs.myget.org/docs/reference/build-services" target="_blank">MyGet Build Services</a> has a convention-type build approach that will create NuGet, npm and VSIX packages whenever required files or project types are available. By adding a <em>build.cmd</em> or <em>build.ps1</em> file, this convention can be overridden – just the thing we want to do to create Chocolatey packages.</p> <p>Using a little bit of PowerShell, we can call into Chocolatey’s <em>choco.exe</em> which handles packaging and verification. The following can be copy/pasted in a build.ps1 file in the root of a GitHub, BitBucket or VSTS repository:</p> <div class="wlWriterEditableSmartContent" id="scid:9D7513F9-C04C-4721-824A-2B34F0212519:6dc3b197-f88b-4249-9510-a759e824a3b0" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; float: none; display: inline;"><pre style="width: 664px; height: 394px; overflow: auto; background-color: white;"><div><!--

Code highlighting produced by Actipro CodeHighlighter (freeware)
http://www.CodeHighlighter.com/

--><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Write</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Host </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">"</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">Building Chocolatey packages...</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">"</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">

</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$nuspecs</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">=</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> Get</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">ChildItem </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Path </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$PSScriptRoot</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255);">Filter</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">*</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">.nuspec </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Recurse

</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255);">foreach</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> (</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$nuspec</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255);">in</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$nuspecs</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">) {
    choco pack </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$nuspec</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">.FullName
}

</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$artifactsFolder</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">=</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">"</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">./artifacts</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">"</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">

Remove</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Item </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Path </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$artifactsFolder</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Force </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Recurse </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
New</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Item </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$artifactsFolder</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Force </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Type Directory </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">|</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"> Out</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Null
Move</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Item </span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">*</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">.nupkg </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 128);">$artifactsFolder</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">

Write</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Host </span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">"</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">Finished building Chocolatey packages.</span><span style="color: rgb(128, 0, 0);">"</span></div></pre><!-- Code inserted with Steve Dunn's Windows Live Writer Code Formatter Plugin.  http://dunnhq.com --></div>
<p>Once a build is triggered on MyGet, this script will execute and create (and upload) Chocolatey packages to our MyGet feed, which we can then install on our system.</p>
<p><em>Happy packaging!</em></p>
